common.conectar_el_adaptador_dlink_dube100_al_p: Connect the D-Link DUB-E100 adapter to the MIB2 unit USB port. Connect el cable Ethernet desde el adaptador al dispositivo Android (v√≠a adaptador USB-C a Ethernet) o a un router WiFi.
common.la_unidad_mib2_generalmente_tiene_una_di: La unidad MIB2 generalmente tiene una direcci√≥n IP est√°tica preasignada en la subred 192.168.1.x (frecuentemente 192.168.1.4 para el host). Configurar el dispositivo con una IP est√°tica en el mismo rango (ej. 192.168.1.10).

common.el_servicio_telnet_puerto_23_puede_estar: Telnet service (port 23) may be active but protected o inactivo por defecto. En versiones de firmware antiguas o espec√≠ficas de Technisat ZR (Zentralrechner), este puerto puede estar abierto, permitiendo una conexi√≥n remota desde una laptop configurada con una IP est√°tica en el mismo rango.
common.una_vez_establecida_la_sesion_telnet_se_: Una vez establecida la sesi√≥n Telnet, se obtiene acceso a la shell de comandos de QNX (ksh).
common.desde_aqui_las_restricciones_de_la_inter: Desde aqu√≠, las restricciones de la interfaz gr√°fica (HMI) son irrelevantes. Se puede montar manualmente la tarjeta SD (que el sistema reconoce como un dispositivo de almacenamiento masivo en /media/mp000 o similar) y ejecutar scripts de shell (install.sh) directamente.
common.descargar_el_mib2_std2_toolbox_desde_el_: Descargar el MIB2 STD2 Toolbox desde el repositorio oficial de GitHub y copiarlo a una tarjeta SD.
common.una_vez_instalado_el_toolbox_ejecutar_la: Una vez instalado el Toolbox, ejecutar la funci√≥n de parcheo desde el men√∫ verde (GEM - Green Engineering Menu) accesible tras la instalaci√≥n.
common.verificar_que_el_toolbox_se_instalo_corr: Verificar que el Toolbox se instal√≥ correctamente y est√° accesible desde el sistema.
common.reiniciar_la_unidad_mib2_para_que_los_ca: Reiniciar la unidad MIB2 para que los cambios surtan efecto.
common.si_el_puerto_telnet_esta_cerrado_y_no_se: Si el puerto Telnet est√° cerrado y no se puede activar mediante codificaci√≥n VCDS, el √∫ltimo recurso es el acceso directo al almacenamiento no vol√°til.

2. Connect your Android device to the same network (WiFi or Ethernet adapter)

toolbox.title: Toolbox Installation
toolbox.warning_message: Esta operaci√≥n puede da√±ar permanentemente tu unidad MIB2. Aseg√∫rate de tener un backup antes de continuar.
toolbox.guia_paso_a_paso_para_instalar_el_mib2_s: Gu√≠a paso a paso para instalar el MIB2 STD2 Toolbox
toolbox.subtitle: Step-by-step guide to install MIB2 STD2 Toolbox
toolbox.warning_text_1: MIB2 Toolbox installation modifies QNX system files. An error can BRICK the MIB2 unit (worth: thousands of dollars).
toolbox.warning_text_2: Patching tsd.mibstd2.system.swap alters the digital signature verification routine. Do not interrupt the process once started.
toolbox.warning_text_3: If something fails, the only way to recover the unit is through direct access to eMMC memory (soldering).
toolbox.script_generated_message: The installation script has been created successfully.
toolbox.critical_step_1_message:
This step modifies the system binary tsd.mibstd2.system.swap.

This alters the digital signature verification routine.

Continue?
toolbox.critical_step_2_message:
An error during this process can BRICK the MIB2 unit.

The only way to recover it would be through direct soldering to eMMC memory.

Are you sure?
toolbox.critical_step_3_message:
Once the process starts, DO NOT interrupt it.

Make sure that:
‚Ä¢ The vehicle battery is charged
‚Ä¢ You won't turn off the ignition
‚Ä¢ The Telnet connection is stable

Execute patching NOW?
toolbox.backup_created_message:
Backup saved successfully:

Path: {path}
Size: {size} KB
Checksum: {checksum}...

Proceeding with patching...
toolbox.backup_error_message:
Could not create backup: {error}

Do you want to continue without backup? (NOT RECOMMENDED)

Backups are saved in:

Android/data/[app]/files/Download/mib2_backups/

To access:
1. Open "Files" or "My Files"
2. Navigate to: Android ‚Üí data ‚Üí [app_name]
3. Enter: files ‚Üí Download ‚Üí mib2_backups

Note: On Android 11+ you need to enable "Show hidden files" to see the Android/data folder.

recovery.restore_error_message: Could not restore EEPROM from backup
recovery.force_restore_message:
This mode attempts to restore EEPROM without security validations.

‚ö†Ô∏è WARNINGS:
‚Ä¢ May permanently damage the adapter
‚Ä¢ Compatibility will not be verified
‚Ä¢ No prior backup will be created

Use this option ONLY if the adapter doesn't respond to normal methods.

Do you want to continue?

auto_spoof.title: Automatic Spoofing
auto_spoof.requirements_message:
‚úÖ BEFORE CONTINUING, VERIFY:

1. OTG cable connected correctly
2. USB adapter plugged in firmly
3. Phone battery >20%
4. You will NOT disconnect the adapter during the process

‚ö†Ô∏è Disconnecting during writing can PERMANENTLY DAMAGE the adapter.

Are all requirements met?
auto_spoof.critical_warning_message:
This operation will permanently modify the USB adapter's EEPROM.

‚ö†Ô∏è RISKS:
‚Ä¢ May brick the device
‚Ä¢ Cannot be easily undone
‚Ä¢ Requires physical reconnection of the adapter

‚úÖ REQUIREMENTS:
‚Ä¢ ASIX AX88772A or AX88772B adapter
‚Ä¢ External EEPROM (NOT eFuse)
‚Ä¢ Stable power during the process

Do you want to continue?
auto_spoof.final_confirmation_message:
This is your last chance to cancel.

The spoofing process will:
1. Read the current EEPROM
2. Create an automatic backup
3. Write the new VID/PID
4. Verify the changes

Are you absolutely sure?
auto_spoof.warning_1: Only works with ASIX AX88772A/B adapters
auto_spoof.warning_4: Do not disconnect during the process

diag.title: Diagnostics
diag.logs_en_tiempo_real_de_todas_las_operaci: Logs en tiempo real de todas las operaciones USB

settings.title: Settings
settings.help_description: Frequently asked questions about the app
settings.faq_adapter_a: Only adapters with ASIX AX88772A or AX88772B chipset with external EEPROM are compatible for spoofing. Realtek, Broadcom or eFuse adapters are NOT compatible. The most recommended adapter is the D-Link DUB-E100 Rev B1.
settings.faq_spoofing_a: Spoofing modifies the manufacturer identifier (VID) and product (PID) of the USB adapter so that the MIB2 unit recognizes it as an authorized device. This enables the Ethernet connection needed to install Toolbox and other modifications.
settings.faq_connection_q: How do I connect to the MIB2 unit?
settings.faq_connection_a: 1) Connect the spoofed USB-Ethernet adapter to the MIB2 USB port. 2) Connect your Android device to the same network (WiFi or Ethernet adapter). 3) The MIB2 normally uses IP 192.168.1.4. 4) Use the app to connect via Telnet with root/root credentials.
settings.faq_toolbox_a: MIB2 Toolbox is a set of tools installed on the unit to enable hidden features like CarPlay, Android Auto, Sport View, digital dashboard customization and more. It requires Telnet access and a compatible USB-Ethernet adapter.
settings.faq_fec_a: FEC codes (Feature Enable Code) are activation codes that unlock premium features on the MIB2 unit. Each code activates a specific function like CarPlay (00060800), Android Auto (00060900) or Performance Monitor (00060400).
settings.faq_risk_a: EEPROM spoofing is permanent and can damage the adapter if interrupted. Modifications to the MIB2 can cause malfunction or warranty loss. Always create backups before any modification. This app is only for advanced users who understand the risks.
settings.tienes_acceso_a_comandos_que_pueden_dana: You have access to commands that can damage the MIB2 unit. Proceed with extreme caution.
settings.subtitle: Adjust application parameters
settings.setup_pin_required: You must first set up a security PIN to use Expert Mode
settings.reset_pin_confirm: Are you sure? This will disable Expert Mode and remove the configured PIN.
settings.expert_mode_warning: You have access to commands that can damage the MIB2 unit. Proceed with extreme caution.
settings.ip_address_desc: IP address of the MIB2 unit on the local network
